goals.question: What is the distribution of wind speed?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind speeds and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind_speed vs wind_direction
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and wind direction.

goals.question: What is the average wind speed by month?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average wind_speed by month
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any seasonal trends in wind speed.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wind direction?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of different wind directions and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind_speed vs temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or correlations between wind speed and temperature.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='wind_speed', color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['wind_speed'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['wind_speed'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['wind_speed'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['wind_speed'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wind speed?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(x='wind_direction', y='wind_speed', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?', wrap=True)
    return plt

data = pd.read_csv('windvectors.csv')
chart = plot(data)
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('windvectors.csv')

# Convert date field to datetime type
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

# Extract month from date field
data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month

# Compute average wind speed by month
avg_wind_speed = data.groupby('month')['wind_speed'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot line chart of average wind speed by month
sns.lineplot(x='month', y='wind_speed', data=avg_wind_speed, color='blue')

# Set chart title
plt.title('What is the average wind speed by month?', wrap=True)

# Set x-axis label
plt.xlabel('Month')

# Set y-axis label
plt.ylabel('Average Wind Speed')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('windvectors.csv')

# Plot histogram of wind direction
sns.histplot(data=data, x='wind_direction', color='blue', kde=True)
plt.axvline(x=data['wind_direction'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['wind_direction'].median()))
plt.title('What is the distribution of wind direction?')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('windvectors.csv')

# Plot scatter plot of wind_speed vs temperature
sns.scatterplot(x='wind_speed', y='temperature', data=data)

# Set chart title
plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)

# Return plot object
plt.show()
```
